steps.title: Welcome to the Academy
steps.content: You've just been accepted to a football academy! Today you meet your new teammates and coach. This is your dream coming true.
steps.cultural_context: Brazilian players often feel nervous about speaking English at first. Remember, everyone wants to help you succeed!
reflection_questions: How do you feel about joining a new academy?
What would you most want to tell your new teammates?
What questions would you ask your coach?

steps.title: Essential Personal Introduction
steps.content: Learn the key phrases to introduce yourself to anyone at the academy.

vocabulary.usage_tip: Always start with a greeting and your name
Tell people your city or state
Your position is part of your football identity

vocabulary.example: The goalkeeper made a great save.

steps.title: Learn the Positions
steps.content: Click on each position to learn where players play and what they do.

interactive_config.instruction: Explore the football pitch! Click on each highlighted position to hear its name and learn what that player does.

click_areas.label: Goalkeeper
click_areas.description: The goalkeeper protects the goal and stops shots. The only player who can use hands in the penalty area.

click_areas.label: Center Back
click_areas.description: Center backs defend and organize the defense. They must be strong in the air and good at tackling.

click_areas.label: Left Back
click_areas.description: The left back defends the left side and supports attacks with overlapping runs.

click_areas.label: Right Back
click_areas.description: The right back defends the right side and makes overlapping runs to support the attack.

click_areas.label: Midfielder
click_areas.description: Midfielders control the game and link defense to attack. They need vision and passing skills.

click_areas.label: Striker
click_areas.description: The striker's job is to score goals. They must have good finishing and positioning.

steps.title: Complete Your Introduction
steps.content: Use what you've learned to complete these introductions.

sentences.hint_context: Your name is what people will call you

sentences.text: I ___ midfielder for my local team.
sentences.hint_context: This is the verb for what you do on the football field
This preposition shows your origin or where you come from

steps.title: Pitch Geography - Areas of the Field
steps.content: Now learn the different areas of the football pitch.

interactive_config.instruction: Click on each highlighted area to learn the names of different parts of the football pitch.

click_areas.label: Penalty Area
click_areas.description: The penalty area is where penalty kicks are awarded for fouls. Also called 'the box'.

click_areas.label: Center Circle
click_areas.description: The center circle is where kick-offs happen. Opponents must stay outside during kick-off.

click_areas.label: Goal
click_areas.description: The goal is where you score points. The ball must completely cross the line.

click_areas.label: Corner
click_areas.description: Corner kicks are taken from the corner of the pitch when the defense touches the ball last.

steps.title: Write Your Introduction
steps.prompt: Write one sentence introducing yourself. Include your name, where you're from, and what position you play.
steps.content: Now write one sentence introducing yourself to your new teammates.
steps.example: Hi, I'm João, I'm from São Paulo and I play midfielder.

language_instructions.en: Write one sentence introducing yourself. Include your name, where you're from, and what position you play.
language_instructions.pt: Escreva uma frase se apresentando. Inclua seu nome, de onde você é e que posição joga.

steps.title: Follow the Ball - Simple Commands
steps.content: Listen to the command and click where the ball should go!

steps.title: Welcome to Your Team!
steps.content: Congratulations! You can now introduce yourself and understand basic football positions. You're ready for your next challenge!
steps.next_lesson_preview: Next: Learn to talk to your coach and get feedback on your speaking!
